intro: Antirrhinum cymbalaria, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas or along pathways. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
